content.text:
# List of awards and nominations received by Orphan Black

{| class="infobox" style="width: 25em; text-align: left; font-size: 90%; vertical-align: middle"
|+ 'List of awards and nominations received by Orphan Black
|-
| colspan="3" style="text-align:center;" |
|-
| style="text-align:center;" colspan="3"|
;Total number of wins and nominations'
|- style="background:#ddf;"
|
|
|
|- style="background:#d9e8ff;"
| colspan="3" style="font-size: smaller; text-align:center;" | Footnotes
|}
Orphan Black is a Canadian science fiction thriller television series created by screenwriter Graeme Manson and director John Fawcett, starring Tatiana Maslany as several identical people who are clones.
Total nominations and awards for the cast
{| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center"
|- bgcolor="#CCCCCC"
!Actor
!Nominations
!Awards
|-
|align="left"|Tatiana Maslany
|39
|23

|3

|4

|3
|1

|2
|0
|-

|1
|1
|-
|align="left"|Michael Mando
|1
|0
|}
ACTRA Toronto Awards
The ACTRA Toronto Awards are given annually by the Alliance of Canadian Cinema, Television and Radio Artists, recognizing outstanding performances by its members. Orphan Black has one win from seven nominations.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2014 || Outstanding Performance – Female || Tatiana Maslany(episode: "Natural Selection") ||  ||
|-
| rowspan=2|2015 || Outstanding Performance – Female || Tatiana Maslany(episode: "By Means Which Have Never Yet Been Tried") ||  || rowspan=2|
|-
| Outstanding Performance – Male || Jordan Gavaris(episode: "Mingling Its Own Nature With It") ||
|-
| rowspan=2|2016 || Outstanding Performance – Female || Tatiana Maslany(episode: "History Yet to Be Written") ||  || rowspan=2|
|-
| Outstanding Performance – Male || Kevin Hanchard(episode: "Formalized, Complex and Costly") ||
|-
| rowspan=2|2017 || Outstanding Performance – Male || Gord Rand(episode: "The Redesign of Natural Objects") ||  || rowspan=2|
|-
| Outstanding Performance – Series Ensemble || Tatiana Maslany, Jordan Gavaris, Maria Doyle Kennedy, Kristian Bruun, Kevin Hanchard ||
|}
Canadian Cinema Editors Awards
The Canadian Cinema Editors is a non-profit organization which promotes the art and science of picture editing in all media, they host annual awards honouring professional film editors. Orphan Black received four nominations with one win.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| rowspan=2|2014 || Best Editing in Long Form Television Series || Stephen Lawrence(episode: "Variation Under Nature") ||  || rowspan=2|
|-
| Best Editing in Long Form Television Series || D. Gillian Truster(episode: "Unconscious Selection") ||
|-
| 2016 || Best Editing in 1 Hour Scripted || Matthew Anas(episode: "Newer Elements of our Defense") ||  ||
|-
| 2017 || Best Editing in 1 Hour Scripted || Jay Prychidny(episode: "The Scandal of Altruism") ||  ||
|}
Canadian Screen Awards
The Canadian Screen Awards are given annually by the Academy of Canadian Cinema & Television recognizing excellence in Canadian film, English-language television, and digital media. Orphan Black has been honoured with 35 awards from 54 nominations.

Constellation Awards
The Constellation Awards were a set of Canadian awards given annually for the best science fiction or fantasy works, the winners were determined by voting by the general public. Orphan Black won four awards from five nominations.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| rowspan=5|2014 || Best Male Performance in a 2013 Science Fiction Television Episode || Jordan Gavaris(episode: "Variations Under Domestication") ||  || rowspan=5|
|-
| Best Female Performance in a 2013 Science Fiction Television Episode || Tatiana Maslany(episode: "Variations Under Domestication") ||
|-
| Outstanding Canadian Contribution to Science Fiction Film or Television in 2013 || Tatiana Maslany ||
|-
| Best Science Fiction Television Series of 2013 || Orphan Black ||
|-
| Best Overall 2013 Science Fiction Film or Television Script || Will Pascoe(episode: "Variations Under Domestication") ||
|}
Critics' Choice Television Awards
The Critics' Choice Television Awards are presented annually by Broadcast Television Journalists Association. Orphan Black has received two awards from four nominations.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2013 || Best Lead Actress in a Drama Series || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|-
| 2014 || Best Lead Actress in a Drama Series || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|-
| 2016 || Best Lead Actress in a Drama Series || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|-
| 2018 || Best Lead Actress in a Drama Series || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|}

The Directors Guild of Canada hosts an annual awards ceremony recognizing achievement in directing, production design, picture and sound editing.

Dorian Awards
The Dorian Awards are organized by the Gay and Lesbian Entertainment Critics Association. Orphan Black has been nominated four times.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
|  rowspan=2|2014 || TV Performance of the Year – Actress || Tatiana Maslany ||  || rowspan=2|
|-
| Unsung TV Show of the Year || Orphan Black ||
|-
| rowspan=2|2015 || TV Performance of the Year – Actress || Tatiana Maslany ||  || rowspan=2|
|-
| Unsung TV Show of the Year || Orphan Black ||
|-
|}
Edgar Allan Poe Awards
The Edgar Allan Poe Awards are presented every year by the Mystery Writers of America, they honor the best in mystery fiction, non-fiction, television, film, and theatre. Orphan Black has been nominated once.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2014 || Best Television Episode Teleplay || Will Pascoe(episode: "Variations Under Domestication") ||  ||
|}
Emmy Awards
The Emmy Awards recognizes excellence in television production and is considered one of the top honors in the industry.  Orphan Black has earned three nominations, resulting in one award.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2015 || Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|-
| 2016 || Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|-
| 2018 || Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series || Tatiana Maslany  ||  ||
|}
EWwy Awards
The EWwys honoured the Emmy-snubbed shows and actors of the year. Orphan Black won three awards from five nominations.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
|rowspan=2|2013 || Best Actress in a Drama Series || Tatiana Maslany ||  || rowspan=2|
|-
|Best Drama Series || Orphan Black ||
|-
|rowspan=2|2014 || Best Actress in a Drama Series || Tatiana Maslany ||  || rowspan=2|
|-
|Best Supporting Actor in a Drama Series || Jordan Gavaris ||
|-
|2015 || Best Supporting Actor in a Drama Series || Jordan Gavaris ||  ||
|}
GLAAD Media Awards
The GLAAD Media Awards are awarded annually by the Gay & Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation. Orphan Black has three nominations.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2014 || Outstanding Drama Series || Orphan Black ||  ||
|-
| 2015 || Outstanding Drama Series || Orphan Black ||  ||
|-
| 2017 || Outstanding Drama Series || Orphan Black ||  ||
|}
Golden Globe Awards
The Golden Globe Award is an accolade bestowed by the 93 members of the Hollywood Foreign Press Association recognizing excellence in film and television, both domestic and foreign. Orphan Black has received one nomination.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2014 || Best Performance in a Television Series – Drama Actress || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|}
Gracie Awards
The Gracie Allen Awards are awarded annually, recognizing exemplary programming created by women, for women and about women in all facets of media and entertainment. Orphan Black has one award.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2014 || Outstanding Female Actor in a Breakthrough Role || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|}
Hugo Awards
The Hugo Awards are a set of awards given annually for the best science fiction or fantasy works. Orphan Black has accepted one award from two nominations.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2014 || Best Dramatic Presentation, Short Form || Will Pascoe, John Fawcett(episode: "Variations Under Domestication") ||  ||
|-
| 2015 || Best Dramatic Presentation, Short Form || Graeme Manson, John Fawcett(episode: "By Means Which Have Never Yet Been Tried") ||  ||
|}
IGN Awards
The IGN Awards are chosen annually by the IGN editors, honoring the best in film, television, games, comics and anime. Orphan Black has two wins from eight nominations.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| rowspan=4|2013 || Best TV Actress || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||

| Best TV Sci-Fi Series || Orphan Black ||  ||
|-
| Best TV Series || Orphan Black ||  ||

| Best New TV Series || Orphan Black ||  ||

|-
| Best TV Actress || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|-
| rowspan=2|2015 || Best TV Sci-Fi Series || Orphan Black ||  ||
|-
| Best TV Actress || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|}
IGN People's Choice Awards
The IGN People's Choice Awards are voted on annually by the general public, they honor the best in film, television, games, comics and anime. Orphan Black has one award.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2014 || Best TV Actress || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|}
Peabody Awards
The Peabody Awards honor the most powerful, enlightening, and invigorating stories in television, radio, and online media. Orphan Black has received one award.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2014 || Peabody Award || Orphan Black ||  ||
|}
People's Choice Awards
The People's Choice Awards is an American awards show recognizing the people and the work of popular culture. The show has been held annually since 1975 and is voted on by the general public. Orphan Black has been nominated twice.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2014 || Favorite Sci-Fi/Fantasy Actress || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|-
| 2017 || Favorite Cable Sci-Fi/Fantasy TV Show || Orphan Black ||  ||
|}
Prix Aurora Awards
The Prix Aurora Awards are annual Canadian awards given out to the best works of science fiction and fantasy.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2016 || Best Visual Presentation || John Fawcett and Graeme Manson ||  ||
|-
| 2017 || Best Visual Presentation || John Fawcett and Graeme Manson ||  ||
|-
| 2018 || Best Visual Presentation || John Fawcett and Graeme Manson ||  ||
|}
Satellite Awards
The Satellite Awards are a set of annual awards given by the International Press Academy. Orphan Black has four nominations.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-

|-
| Best Actress in a Drama Series || Tatiana Maslany ||
|-
| rowspan=2|2017 || Best Actress in a Series – Drama or Genre || Tatiana Maslany ||  || rowspan=2|
|-
| Best Television Series – Genre || Orphan Black ||
|}
Screen Actors Guild Awards
The Screen Actors Guild Awards are organized by the Screen Actors Guild‐American Federation of Television and Radio Artists. First awarded in 1995, the awards aim to recognize excellent achievements in film and television. Orphan Black has one nomination.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2015 || Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Drama Series || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|}
TCA Awards
The members of the Television Critics Association vote annually for outstanding achievements in television. Orphan Black has one award from three nominations.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-

|-

|2013 || Most Underrated Show || Orphan Black ||  ||

TV Guide Awards
The TV Guide Awards are annual awards created by the editors of TV Guide magazine, as a readers poll to honor outstanding programs and performers in the American television industry. Orphan Black has been nominated twice.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| rowspan=2|2014 || Favorite Sci-Fi/Fantasy Show || Orphan Black ||  || rowspan=2|
|-
| Favorite Actress || Tatiana Maslany ||
|}
Writers Guild of Canada Awards
The Writers Guild of Canada represents English-language screenwriters in Canada, their annual awards honour excellence in screenwriting. Orphan Black has earned three awards from five nominations.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref

Young Artist Awards
The Young Artist Awards are awarded annually to young actors in film and television. Orphan Black has received one nomination.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2015 || Best Performance in a TV Series – Recurring Young Actress 17–21 || Zoé De Grand Maison ||  ||
|}
Young Hollywood Awards
The Young Hollywood Awards were awards presented annually which honor the year's biggest achievements in pop music, movies, sports, television, fashion and more, as voted on by teenagers and young adults. Orphan Black has one award.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! width=5%|Year !! width=45%|Category !! width=40%|Nominee !! width=10%|Result !! width=3%|Ref
|-
| 2013 || Breakthrough Performance — Female || Tatiana Maslany ||  ||
|}
